main event: Multiple unidentified objects were tracked on radar and visually observed over Bentwaters and Lakenheath, England on the night of 13-14 August 1956.
interesting points: Radar operators reported tracking several unidentified targets for up to 2-3 minutes at speeds exceeding 600-800 mph., Visual observation described an orange-red object hovering and then accelerating rapidly., Some objects displayed the ability to split and merge during observation., The objects exhibited characteristics inconsistent with known aircraft capabilities., Extensive military investigations were conducted but concluded with no definitive identification of the observed phenomena.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects tracked on radar and visually seen
witness description: RAF radar operators and USAF personnel
